New Records: Anthony Volpe set a record for a single playoffs with a World Series grand slam
Freddie Freeman has now homered in six consecutive World Series games, breaking a tie with George Springer
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a World Series grand slam in the third inning
Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in Game 1
Will Smith and Austin Wells each homered in Game 4
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his pride in his team's performance, despite the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are the first team to force a Game 5 when down 3-0 in a World Series since the Reds in 1970 against the Orioles
The Yankees are only the 10th team to avoid a sweep when down 3-0 in a best-of-seven postseason series
Freddie Freeman has now homered in his last four games, breaking a tie with 1985 Bill Madlock for the longest streak in Dodgers postseason history
Others: Anthony Volpe became the second player with multiple extra-base hits and stolen bases in a World Series game, joining Eddie Collins
The 120th World Series is just the fourth with multiple grand slams
Freddie Freeman has 10 RBIs this series, passing Gil Hodges and Duke Snider for most RBIs in a World Series in Dodgers history
